text: Ephraim Faces Punishment
Do not rejoice, \add O\add* Israel,
do not exult like the nations!
For you played the whore, departing from your God;
you loved a harlot’s wage
on all the threshing floors of grain.
Threshing floor and wine vat will not feed them,
and new wine will fail her.\f + \fr 9:2 \ft That is, Israel \f*
They will not remain
in the land of Yahweh.
But Ephraim will return \add to\add* Egypt,
and in Assyria they will eat unclean food.
They will not pour \add drink offerings of\add* wine to Yahweh,
and their sacrifices will not please him.
\add They are\add* like mourners’ bread for them;
all those who eat it will be defiled.
For their bread will be ⸤for their hunger⸥;\f + \fr 9:4 \ft Literally “for their soul” \f*
it will not come \add to\add* the house of Yahweh.
What will you do on the day of \add the\add* appointed time,
and on the day of the festival of Yahweh?
For look! \add If\add* they flee from the destruction,
Egypt will gather them;
Memphis\f + \fr 9:6 \ft Hebrew “Noph” \f* will bury them.
Nettles will possess
their precious things of silver;
thorns \add will be\add* in their tents.
The days of punishment have come;
the days of retribution have come;
Israel knows!
The prophet \add is\add* a fool,
the man of the spirit \add is\add* acting like a madman.
Because of the greatness of your sin,
\add your\add* hostility \add is\add* great.
The prophet keeps watch \add over\add* Ephraim for my God;
the snare of a fowler \add is\add* on all his ways,
and hostility in the house of his God.
⸤They deeply corrupted themselves⸥\f + \fr 9:9 \ft Literally “They made deep, they corrupted themselves” \f*
as \add in\add* the days of Gibeah;
he will remember their sin,
he will punish their sins.
Like the grapes in the wilderness,
I found Israel.
Like early ripened fruit on the fig tree in the first season,\f + \fr 9:10 \ft Or “in the beginning” \f*
I saw your ancestors.\f + \fr 9:10 \ft Or “fathers” \f*
They themselves came \add to\add* Baal Peor,
and they consecrated themselves to shame.
And they became detestable things,
like ⸤the thing they love⸥.\f + \fr 9:10 \ft Literally “like loving things” \f*
Ephraim’s glory \add is\add* like a bird;
it will fly away—
no birth, no pregnancy, and no conception.
Even though they bring up their children,
I will bereave them before maturity.\f + \fr 9:12 \ft Or “until no one is left” \f*
Woe to them indeed,
when I depart from them!
Ephraim, as I see \add it\add*,
\add is\add* like a palm in a meadow;
but Ephraim must bring out
his children to the slayer.
Give them, \add O\add* Yahweh—
what will you give \add them\add*?
Give them a miscarrying womb
and dry breasts.
Every evil of theirs \add began\add* at Gilgal,
so I \add began\add* to hate them there;
because of the evil of their deeds
I will drive them out from my house.
I will love them no more;
all their officials \add are\add* rebels.
Ephraim is stricken,
their root is dried up,
they shall not bear fruit.
Even if they give birth,
I will kill the cherished offspring of their womb.
My God will reject them
because they did not listen to him,
and they will be wanderers among the nations.
